I am a Stefan E. Warschawski [:Visiting Assistant Professor](#x-vap) in the [Department of Mathematics](https://www.math.ucsd.edu/) at [UC San Diego](https://www.ucsd.edu/), mentored by [Ery Arias-Castro](https://mathweb.ucsd.edu/~eariasca/). My research interests lie in the intersection of topological data analysis, statistical learning theory, and probabilistic methods. 

I completed my Ph.D. at [Penn State University](https://www.psu.edu/), advised by [Bharath Sriperumbudur](https://bharathsv.github.io/), where I was honored to receive the [Alumni Association Dissertation Award](https://science.psu.edu/news/2023-alumni-association-dissertation-awards). At Penn State, I was also a research assistant and consultant with the [Statistical Consulting Center](https://scc.stat.psu.edu/).

Prior to joining Penn State, I worked as a quantitative researcher at Goldman Sachs from 2016 to 2017, and as a model validation quant at Nomura from 2015 to 2016. I graduated from the [Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur](https://www.iitk.ac.in/) with a degree in Mathematics and Statistics.
:::
